entities.description: Refers to cases of human trafficking specifically involving commercial sex acts.
Represents data entries that are missing or not available in the survey.
Involves the willful (non-negligent) killing of one human being by another.
Refers to the killing of another person through gross negligence.
The killing of a felon by a law enforcement officer in the line of duty or the killing of a felon during the commission of a felony by a private citizen.
Entails the unlawful seizure, transportation, and/or detention of a person against their will.
Includes all forms of non-consensual sexual penetration.
Involves oral or anal sexual intercourse without consent.
Non-consensual penetration of a person by an object.
Touching of the private body parts of another person for sexual gratification without consent, including incidents involving minors.
The taking or attempting to take anything of value by force or threat of force.
An unlawful attack by one person upon another with the intent to inflict severe or aggravated bodily injury.
An unlawful physical attack by one person upon another without the use of a weapon and not resulting in serious injury.
To unlawfully place another person in reasonable fear of bodily harm through the use of threatening words and/or other conduct.
Willfully or maliciously setting, or attempting to set, fire to a structure, vehicle, or property.
Obtaining money, property, or anything else of value through the use of threat or coercion.
The unlawful entry into a building with the intent to commit a felony or theft.
Theft of articles from another person's physical possession without the use of force.
Theft of a purse, handbag, etc., from the custody of an individual without the use of force.
Theft by a person of goods or merchandise exposed for sale.
Theft within a building which is open to the general public without force, violence, or fraud.

entities.entity: Theft From Coin-Operated Machine or Device
entities.description: Theft from a machine or device operated by coins or tokens.
Theft of articles from a motor vehicle, either locked or unlocked.
Theft of any parts or accessories from a motor vehicle in which the parts or accessories are attached.
All thefts that do not fit any of the definitions of the specific subcategories listed above.

relationships.description: Relates the UCR arrest offense code to specific crimes.
Provides a detailed description of the crime.
Indicates the number of times the crime has been reported.
Represents the frequency percentage of the reported incidents.
Indicates data entries that are missing in the dataset.
